clamábo~; Deus meus: vocem deprecatiónis meaĕ dum oro ad te~; dum extòllo manûs meas ad templum sanctum tuum. ^ Hear
when I pray to thee~; when I lift up my hands to thy holy temple.

1 ^ Ad te: 3 ^ Ne sìmul trahas me cum peccatóribus
Dòmine: et cum operántibus iniqŭitátem ne pèrdas me~; qŭi loqŭùntur pacem cum pròximo suo
clamábo~; Deus meus: mala aŭtem in córdibus eórum. ^ Draw me not away together with the wicked
ne sìleas a me: and with the workers of iniquity destroy me not~; who speak peace with their neighbour
ne qŭando táceas a me: but evils are in their hearts.

Dòmine: et secùndum neqŭìtiam adinventiónum ipsórum. Secùndum ópera mánuum eórum trìbue illîs~; redde retributiónem eórum ìpsîs. ^ Give them according to their works
clamábo~; Deus meus: and according to the wickedness of their inventions. According to the works of their hands give thou to them~; render to them their reward.

Dòmine: et in ópera mánuum ejus~; déstrues illos
clamábo~; Deus meus: et non aĕdificábis eos. ^ Because they have not understood the works of the Lord
ne sìleas a me: and the operations of his hands~; thou shalt destroy them
ne qŭando táceas a me: and shalt not build them up.

Dòmine: qŭóniam exaŭdívit vocem deprecatiónis meaĕ. ^ Blessed be the Lord
clamábo~; Deus meus: for he hath heard the voice of my supplication.

Dòmine: et protéctor meus~; in ìpso sperávit cor meum et adjútus sum
ne sìleas a me: et èx voluntáte mea confitébor ei. ^ The Lord is my helper and my protector~; in him hath my heart confided and I have been helped
ne qŭando táceas a me: and my flesh hath flourished again
and with my will I will give praise to him.

Dòmine: et protéctor salvatiónum christi sui est. ^ The Lord is the strength of his people
clamábo~; Deus meus: and the protector of the salvation of his anointed.

ne qŭando táceas a me: et extòlle illos usqŭe in aĕtèrnum. ^ Save thy people
